title: Alcoa’s Sales Rise 31% on Strong Aluminium Prices
sub_head: Shipments fell in latest quarter in part because railcars were lacking
body:
Alcoa Corp. reported sharply higher sales for the third quarter, propped up by higher aluminum and alumina prices.
The aluminum maker said sales increased 31% to $3.11 billion, from $2.37 billion in the year-earlier quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimate of $2.93 billion.
